image.altText: Scott Morrison, wearing a long winter jacket, walks out of a construction site followed by two men and a woman.

items.synopsis: Multiple previously secret reports scrutinising the $2.3 billion HomeBuilder scheme have found a lack of governance, controls and risk management.

title.children: HomeBuilder scheme 'overheated' construction and blindsided states, reports find

image.altText: Smoke rises from Loy Yang Power Station, which is seen in silhouette against a yellow sunset

items.synopsis: Australia's energy transition has reached a tipping point, and experts are warning consumers to brace for a bumpy ride over the next decade.

title.children: Higher power prices the 'new normal' as Australia moves towards cleaner future

image.altText: a tub of coyo yogburt sitting on a bench in the sun

items.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast company which manufactures "dairy-free" coconut yoghurt and ice cream products is being sued in the Queensland Supreme Court following a woman's death in the UK.

title.children: Queensland 'dairy-free' yoghurt manufacturer COYO sued after UK woman's anaphylaxis death

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory Court of Appeal has dismissed former NT Police constable Zachary Rolfe's bid to avoid questions at the coronial inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Court rules Zachary Rolfe must give evidence at Kumanjayi Walker inquest

image.altText: Boys play in mud after rain in western Queensland

items.synopsis: Warm winter temperatures are about to plummet with widespread rainfall predicted to sweep across Queensland from today.

title.children: 'Unusual' winter rainfall is on the way. Here's what it means for Queensland

image.altText: Three-year-old William Tyrrell has been missing from his NSW mid north coast home since late last week.

items.synopsis: NSW detectives recommend William Tyrrell's foster mother be charged with covering up the death of the three year old who went missing in 2014.

title.children: Detectives recommend charges against William Tyrrell's foster mother over toddler's disappearance

image.altText: A man in a suit with his arms folded

items.synopsis: New details of the case emerge in court, with the Sydney businessman accused of selling Australian defence and security secrets in China.

title.children: Sydney man accused of foreign interference was warned to leave China by suspected US spy, court hears

image.altText: Noelene and Cedric Jordan pictured walking in a city street.

items.synopsis: If you saw them in the street you might think they seem like most older married couples — but a jury has just found them guilty of the shooting murder of their former son-in-law in 2009. So, why did it take 11 years to charge them?

title.children: The 'elimination matrix' which brought this grandfather and grandmother undone

image.altText: Jordans and Shane Barker composite thumb.

items.synopsis: A jury has taken just nine hours to unanimously find a Tasmanian couple guilty of murdering their former son-in-law Shane Barker in 2009.

title.children: Tasmanian couple found guilty of 2009 murder of ex son-in-law

image.altText: A toddler strapped into a pram.

items.synopsis: The death of 17-month-old Ronan this month is declared a major crime. No arrests have been made or charges laid. Here's a look at what is known so far. WARNING: This story contains details readers may find distressing.

title.children: This 17-month-old was allegedly murdered — here's what we know so far about Ronan's death

image.altText: Lukashenko confirms Wagner chief Prigozhin's arrival in Belarus

items.synopsis: Russian authorities close a criminal investigation into the aborted armed rebellion led by mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, and are pressing no charges against him or his troops.

title.children: 'They will squash you like a bug': Lukashenko says he warned Wagner boss against march on Moscow

image.altText: aerial of ship spraying sea water

items.synopsis: Queensland scientists are the first to practically test the cloud brightening theory, shooting sea spray over the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Could brightening clouds help tackle climate change? These scientists are trying to find out

image.altText: The back of a white ute, with the word "Jovi" graffitied on the back in black spraypaint.

items.synopsis: The Jon Bon Jovi Boys, or Jovi Boys, hail from a remote community of less than 200 people. Residents there say they're "terrorising" the community and they've had enough of their bad behaviour.

title.children: 'They've got no respect': Jon Bon Jovi Boys outback gang in sights of NT police

image.altText: Taylor Swift's Facebook profile picture

items.synopsis: General sale tickets will be released on Friday, but Swift fans will be attempting to secure their spots in a special pre-sale event. It's going to be tense.

title.children: Taylor Swift pre-sale tickets are released today. Sellers are braced for huge demand

image.altText: Two men look over notes on a tablet.

items.synopsis: Ben Stokes says he is prepared for Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne to bounce back in the second Test, as England drops Moeen Ali for an extra seamer.

title.children: England makes bold selection call for Lord's Test as Stokes prepares for Aussie stars to bounce back

image.altText: An illustration of a library, featuring a desk with a blue box containing a head.

items.synopsis: With mystery surrounding its origins, the mummified head poses all sorts of questions about the past, present and future.

title.children: This Australian high school's human head and a mysterious note pose big questions about ancient Egypt

image.altText: Servicemen sit in a tank with a flag of the Wagner Group military company.

items.synopsis: When Ivan Rossomakhin returned home from the war in Ukraine three months ago, his neighbours in the village east of Moscow were terrified.

title.children: A convicted murderer fought for Wagner in Ukraine. Ten days after returning to Russia, he allegedly killed an elderly woman

image.altText: an aerial view of a station homestead and a cattle feedlot.

items.synopsis: Helicopter charter company Top End Mustering said the highly experienced pilot was performing routine mustering when their Robinson R22 chopper crashed on Tuesday.

title.children: Pilot killed after helicopter crashes during mustering operations on remote station

image.altText: An alleged Australian-built cardboard drone lies nose down with a twig stuck in it

items.synopsis: Photos appear online purporting to show an Australian-made drone that recently crashed inside Russian territory with an explosive strapped to it.

title.children: Pro-Putin military bloggers claim Australian-built cardboard drone was brought down inside Russia

image.altText: A man in a tuxedo speaks at a dais.

items.synopsis: Port Adelaide's only AFL premiership coach uses his Hall of Fame speech to back the Voice referendum, as seven new faces are added to the illustrious group.

title.children: 'We have to do the right thing': Hall of Fame inductee uses speech to laud AFL's Voice stance

image.altText: Jason Clare speaks at a lecturn in front of Australian flags

items.synopsis: The education minister describes PwC's failure to disclose its interest in Top Education Group, while conducting a confidential review into the regulator of private colleges, as "completely unacceptable".

title.children: PwC's failure to disclose interest in private education provider 'completely unacceptable'

image.altText: Gambling advertisement at an AFL game.

items.synopsis: Committee chair Peta Murphy says Australians are among the biggest gambling losers anywhere in the world, and previous attempts to regulate gambling advertising have failed to address the problem.

title.children: Gambling ads should be banned within three years to tackle addiction crisis, parliamentary committee says

image.altText: A man embraces a woman who is crying in fading light.

items.synopsis: Emergency services scurried in and out of the shattered restaurant as residents stood outside surveying the damage from the strike, which occurred just before 8pm local time on Tuesday night.

title.children: Deadly Russian missile strikes hit popular restaurant in Ukraine's Donetsk region, killing four

image.altText: An angry look cassowary looks up at the camera.

items.synopsis: The endangered southern cassowary looks akin to its prehistoric ancestors and there's a national push to save this "beautiful" giant bird from disappearing.

title.children: Renewed push to save southern cassowary, Australia's own 'living dinosaur'

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair and glasses stands in front of rows of bread and smiles

items.synopsis: As the current financial year comes to an end, councils across Tasmania are upping their rates, leaving residents and business owners struggling to balance the books.

title.children: 'Domino effect' in cost-of-living increases hit already struggling customers

image.altText: A white bus on its side surrounded by emergency services personnel in high vis.

items.synopsis: Private ambulance crews asked to help on the day of last month’s horror Eynesbury school bus crash were instead directed to do non-urgent private contract jobs, workers have alleged, saying operators are putting profit over patient care every day.

title.children: Private ambulance operators allegedly directed staff to contract jobs on day of Eynesbury school bus crash

image.altText: Donald Trump pictured making a fist while speaking into microphone at podium with US flag in background.

items.synopsis: The audio file includes a moment when Mr Trump seems to indicate he is holding a secret Pentagon document with plans to attack Iran, and he refers to something as "highly confidential" and "secret information".

title.children: Donald Trump says recording of him discussing secret documents is 'actually an exoneration'

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in his 2017 mug shot.

items.synopsis: The US Justice Department's internal watchdog singles out 13 prison employees for "misconduct and dereliction of their duties".

title.children: Scathing report finds prison guard misconduct led to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide

image.altText: Police officers and cars outside building with police tape

items.synopsis: Detectives have found a firearm left behind at one of the crime scenes after Tuesday's shooting death of a prominent Sydney underworld figure, which may be the potential murder weapon.

title.children: Pistol found by police at Bondi Junction crime scene after drug kingpin shot dead

image.altText: The back of a man's head looking at a ASX sign

items.synopsis: Federal Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the budget surplus could exceed $4.2 billion, and inflation is tipped to cool ahead of the next RBA meeting. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX follows Wall Street higher, budget surplus predicted to exceed $4.2 billion,  inflation tipped to cool

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: HomeBuilder was one of the Morrison government's signature COVID-19 policies, but multiple previously secret reports found it blindsided the states, "overheated" the construction sector and lacked appropriate governance, record-keeping or reporting. The COVID-19 stimulus scheme paid home owners up to $25,000 to build new homes or renovate existing homes. My colleague Dan Ziffer has discovered through Freedom of Information requests that secret reports were scathing about the set up and governance of the multi billion dollar scheme.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HomeBuilder 'overheated' the construction industry

featuredLink.title: HomeBuilder scheme 'overheated' construction and blindsided states, reports find

children.content: HomeBuilder was one of the Morrison government's signature COVID-19 policies, but multiple previously secret reports found it blindsided the states, "overheated" the construction sector and lacked appropriate governance, record-keeping or reporting.
The COVID-19 stimulus scheme paid home owners up to $25,000 to build new homes or renovate existing homes.
My colleague
Dan Ziffer
has discovered through Freedom of Information requests that secret reports were scathing about the set up and governance of the multi billion dollar scheme.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Australian share market has gained in early trade after a rally on Wall Street. The ASX 200 index has put on 0.7 per cent in the first 10 minutes of trade. Nearly all sectors have increased with banks, consumer stocks, and real estate firms among the gainers. Utilities are in the red. Ramsay Health Care (+6.3 per cent) is the best performer, while gold miner Regis Resources (-2.1 per cent) is the worst performer. Ramsay has surged as it considers selling its Asian healthcare business, which is a joint venture with Malaysian conglomerate Sime Darby Bhd.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australian shares open higher

children.content: The Australian share market has gained in early trade after a rally on Wall Street.
The ASX 200 index has put on 0.7 per cent in the first 10 minutes of trade.
Nearly all sectors have increased with banks, consumer stocks, and real estate firms among the gainers.
Utilities are in the red.
Ramsay Health Care (+6.3 per cent) is the best performer, while gold miner Regis Resources (-2.1 per cent) is the worst performer.
Ramsay has surged as it considers selling its Asian healthcare business, which is a joint venture with Malaysian conglomerate Sime Darby Bhd.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: As Qantas boss Alan Joyce prepares to leave, the airline has announced an overhaul to management. Last month, Qantas announced that chief financial officer Vanessa Hudson would take over from Alan Joyce, becoming the airline's first female chief executive. Today Qantas announced that Qantas head of strategy, people and technology, Rob Marcolina, will become the new chief financial officer. Chief customer office Markus Svensson will become Qantas Domestic chief executive when Andrew David retires in September. Catriona Larritt will take on the role of chief customer and digital officer with responsibility for technology added to the job. Safety boss Andrew Monaghan will take on the new role of chief risk officer, and the airline will create a chief people officer to oversee human resources and industrial relations. Here's what Vanessa Hudson had to say. “We have a deep bench of experience at Qantas, which means we’re able to recruit internally for many senior executive roles when they come up, and that makes transition a lot smoother," Ms Hudson says. “The structural changes announced today are about increasing our focus on a few key areas as we move from recovery to growth, especially when it comes to things that matter most to our people and our customers." 'Investing in digital is a huge part of our plans to keep improving customer experience. " "That's why we are adding responsibility for technology to the chief customer officer's portfolio."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Qantas management overhaul

children.content: As Qantas boss Alan Joyce prepares to leave, the airline has announced an overhaul to management.
Last month, Qantas announced that chief financial officer
Vanessa Hudson
would take over from Alan Joyce, becoming the airline's first female chief executive.
Today Qantas announced that Qantas head of strategy, people and technology,
Rob Marcolina
, will become the new chief financial officer.
Chief customer office
Markus Svensson
will become Qantas Domestic chief executive when Andrew David retires in September.
Catriona Larritt
will take on the role of chief customer and digital officer with responsibility for technology added to the job.
Safety boss
Andrew Monaghan
will take on the new role of chief risk officer, and the airline will create a chief people officer to oversee human resources and industrial relations.
Here's what Vanessa Hudson had to say.

“We have a deep bench of experience at Qantas, which means we’re able to recruit internally for many senior executive roles when they come up, and that makes transition a lot smoother," Ms Hudson says.

“The structural changes announced today are about increasing our focus on a few key areas as we move from recovery to growth, especially when it comes to things that matter most to our people and our customers."
'Investing in digital is a huge part of our plans to keep improving customer experience. "
"That's why we are adding responsibility for technology to the chief customer officer's portfolio."

image.altText: A composite of two images of a man with a beard and a blue shirt carving an old brick wall.

items.synopsis: Italy's culture and tourism ministers vow to find and punish a tourist who was filmed carving into the wall of Rome's Colosseum.

title.children: Tourist filmed carving his and girlfriend's name into Colosseum faces $24,550 fine
